definition: to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: Students′oversight in the course of topic exploring will lead to the failure of their compositions.
sentences.chinese: 审题时的疏漏会导致作文失败，写作成绩不理想。

sentences.english: Several Chinese dairies are suspected of negligence in allowing the distribution of tainted milk products.
sentences.chinese: 几个中国牛奶场被怀疑在有毒乳制品散布上的有疏漏。

sentences.english: My apologies to time for all the world I overlook each second.
sentences.chinese: 我为自己分分秒秒疏漏万物向时间致歉。

sentences.english: Common ownership, Aristotle argues, will mean a sort of common neglect.
sentences.chinese: 亚里士多德论及，共同所有权等同于一种共同的疏漏。

sentences.english: This is just one of the many careless oversights concerning July School studying.
sentences.chinese: 这只是关于七月派研究的许多疏漏之一。

sentences.english: Britain has been fretting this week over lapses in its border controls (see article).
sentences.chinese: 英国本周也在为入境管理中的疏漏烦恼不已。

sentences.english: For instance a cluttered environment gives the impression of chaos, disorganisation and sloppiness .
sentences.chinese: 比如一个杂乱的环境给人混乱，组织混乱和疏漏。

sentences.english: Their absence results in a book that is too crude to be convincing.
sentences.chinese: 但他们的疏漏也使得本书太过粗略而难以服众。

sentences.english: The more oversight, the more the need exists for documentation to communicate to management.
sentences.chinese: 疏漏越多，说明需要更多的文档用来交流管理。

sentences.english: One official has already said that there was a lapse in security.
sentences.chinese: 一名负责人已经表示，故宫的安保措施确实存在疏漏。

sentences.english: Thereafter, he began reporting directly to the CEO to help prevent similar oversights .
sentences.chinese: 此后，他开始直接向行政总裁，以帮助防止类似疏漏。

definition: to fail in observing or supervising/to miss/to let sth slip through
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to miss/to leave out/to omit/to be omitted/to be missing/to slip through/to leak out/to seep away
